author: Regina F. Graham For Dailymail.com
title: Beverly Hills mansion hits the market for $100MILLION
text:
A massive brand-new home built in the exclusive 90210 zip code just hit the market for a whopping $100million.
Built by developer Nile Niami and architect Paul McClean, the 20,500-square-foot Opus spec house is perched above Los Angeles.
Located on the highly sought-after Hillcrest Road, the spectacular mansion, which is being called Opus, comes with a gold Lamborghini Aventador roadster and a gold Rolls-Royce Dawn inside the car museum that has room for a total of 10 vehicles to be displayed.
The Opus, which is listed by Hilton & Hyland with listing agent Drew Fenton, comes complete with seven bedrooms, 11 bathrooms, as the property sits on one acre of land that offers jetliner views of Los Angeles from Downtown all the way to the Pacific Ocean.
Perfection: A massive brand-new home built in the exclusive 90210 zip code just hit the market for a whopping $100million
All gold everything: The spectacular mansion, which is being called Opus, comes with a gold Lamborghini Aventador roadster and a gold Rolls-Royce Dawn inside the car museum that has room for a total of 10 vehicles to be displayed
Bubbly: An extraordinary champagne vault with 170 bottles of Cristal Champagne is built inside the abode and included in the sale price
Crisp: On top of the champagne room, two full bars can be found within the massive home, as it also include a wine station
Flawless: All of the furniture inside of the Opus and the contemporary art collection that includes over $2million in original Damien Hirst paintings and a portrait of late boxing legend Muhammad Ali by Andy Warhol, are included in the sale price
Ideal: The exquisite mansion wouldn't be complete without the gourmet show kitchen with an iPad controlled top brewer as it's steps away from the outdoor pool
Exclusivity: The brand new home features Roberto Cavalli flooring and Longhi doors in suede and embossed leather, as
The spectacular master suite inside the Opus includes dual baths and closets, as the suit also offers views of the entire city.
Twelve foot ceilings can be found throughout the huge mansion that also has motorized sliding doors, Roberto Cavalli flooring and Longhi doors in suede and embossed leather.
The abode is perfect for hosting guests, as there is also a 15-person curved screening room, two swimming pools, a champagne vault with 170 bottles of Cristal Champagne and two full bars as one has it's very own wine station.
Not to mention, the hefty price tag includes a contemporary art collection with over $2million in original Damien Hirst paintings and a portrait of late boxing legend Muhammad Ali by Andy Warhol.
All of the furniture inside of the Opus and art by other blue chip artists is being sold as part of the deal.
Spectacular: The Opus is located on one of the most highly sought-after streets in Beverly Hills, and is currently the most expensive home being sold in the area
Fancy: The property sits on one acre as the views during the day and night from within the home are simply breathtaking thanks to the motorized sliding doors that open it up completely
The property, which is currently the most expensive home being sold in the area, boasts a wellness center with a cold and hot plunge, steam and massage room.
In addition, the future homeowner can have a stylist come to the home as there is also a beauty salon with a manicure and pedicure station and a hair cutting and washing basin inside the Opus.
The exquisite mansion wouldn't be complete without the gourmet show kitchen with an iPad controlled top brewer.
In addition, there is a separate catering and even kitchen on the property.
Dive in: The Opus has two swimming pools, as the one pictured above inside the abode has plenty of space allowing several people to take a dip all at once
Alluring: The dining area inside the abode has the perfect amount of room at the table to comfortably host friends and family for an amazing meal
Fresh: The Opus, which is listed by Hilton & Hyland with listing agent Drew Fenton, comes complete with seven bedrooms, as the one pictured above features an amazing view of Los Angeles
Pristine: A total of 11 bathrooms can be found inside the huge mansion that offers 12-foot ceilings throughout
Grandiose: The Opus also has a hair salon inside the abode that features a manicure and pedicure station as well as hair washing basin
Relaxed: An exquisite massage room, featuring a white state of the art massage table, is also located inside the spectacular home
Opus is Niami's precursor to the most expensive private residence that will be sold in the country.
He is currently developing a property in the costly Bel-Air neighborhood that will list for a whopping $500million.
The ex-movie producer turned mega developer explained why he decided to build the elegant mansion Opus in the exclusive 90210 neighborhood.
'It is the most prominent street with the most commanding views in all of Beverly Hills,' Niami told DailyMail.com.
Unwind: Steps away from the indoor pool, a wellness center that includes a cold and hot plunge, steam and massage room can be found allowing the future homeowner an area just to unwind
Benefits: Cold and hot plunge small pools, similar to the ones inside of the abode, are said to provide several benefits to the body by those who use them including helping with stress and muscles aches
Impressive: Views from inside the bedrooms, both during day and night, show the impressive and amazing city below
Comfortable: The curved screening room comfortably allows 15 people to enjoy an evening of entertainment inside the area within the mansion
'It is rare that anyone is able to acquire a lot such as this. There is nothing left on Hillcrest of this size and the home is turnkey.
'This is the only home of this caliber that will be available to a potential buyer.
'None of the neighbors are moving anytime soon which makes Billionaires Row one of the most sought after acquisition opportunities in the world.'
He previously sold a home to rapper Sean Combs in Holmby Hills in 2014 for $39million and he developed and sold another Holmby Hills home to a Saudi buyer for $49 million.
Breathtaking: The deck area immediately outside of the home features a cozy fire pit surrounded by a gorgeous seating area that's just steps away from the outdoor pool
Striking: Niami told DailyMail.com that 'this is the only home of this caliber that will be available to a potential buyer'
Commanding: He added that Opus is located on 'the most prominent street with the most commanding views in all of Beverly Hills'
